definition: to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]
good people are at peace with themselves, (but) there is no rest for the wicked
pinyin: jun1 zi5 tan3 dang4 dang4 , xiao3 ren2 chang2 qi1 qi1
containing_words.word: 君子坦荡荡，小人长戚戚

sentences.english: He was completely honest in his reply.
sentences.chinese: 他的回答完全是坦坦荡荡。

sentences.english: Wang Pengwei sat in his empty restaurant feeling very frustrated.
sentences.chinese: 王鹏伟坐在他那空荡荡的餐馆里，感到很沮丧。

sentences.english: Empty is the White Horse Temple tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今夜的白马寺空空荡荡。

sentences.english: Technical onrush always is billow forward, vast and mighty, cannot hold back.
sentences.chinese: 技术洪流总是滚滚向前，浩浩荡荡，无法阻挡。

sentences.english: Sharp wind screaming through the deserted streets of Changchun University.
sentences.chinese: 锐利的风尖叫着穿过空荡荡的长春大学所有街道。

sentences.english: Today, most of them are empty" ghost towns."
sentences.chinese: 今天，大多数镇子是空荡荡的“鬼镇”。

sentences.english: My son died, now I feel empty.
sentences.chinese: 我儿子往世了，我内心空荡荡的。

sentences.english: You could also wear jewellery such as wire bracelets and some dangling earrings.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以戴些像手镯和晃晃荡荡的耳环之类的饰品。

sentences.english: Singing and shouting slogans, the parade moved across the square like a flood.
sentences.chinese: 游行队伍唱着歌，呼着口号，浩浩荡荡穿过广场。

sentences.english: Leading that grand armada were the minesweepers.
sentences.chinese: 这支浩浩荡荡舰队的先锋是扫雷舰。

sentences.english: The airport was like a ghost town, the terminal was empty and eerily silent.
sentences.chinese: 机场像座鬼城，候机大楼空空荡荡，寂静得可怕。

sentences.english: The army ants are on the move.
sentences.chinese: 蚂蚁大军浩浩荡荡的出发了。

sentences.english: Who gave me the name of May, to go forward with great strength and vigour of a ceramic rhyme?
sentences.chinese: 是谁赋予我五月的名义，赶赴一场浩浩荡荡的瓷韵？

sentences.english: They were marching in an apparently endless line past the Great White Throne.
sentences.chinese: 他们排成浩浩荡荡的队伍，整齐经过白色大宝座。

sentences.english: The work space is a bare and cavernous warehouse.
sentences.chinese: 工作场地是个空荡荡的大仓库。

sentences.english: He had a full seidel of beer in his right hand and his empty left sleeve was flapping.
sentences.chinese: 他的右手拿着一整杯啤酒，空荡荡的左袖管扑扇着。

definition: as empty as anything (idiom); completely bereft/to have nothing/vacuous/hollow/empty (argument, head etc)
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
congestion/to block/to congest/to crowd/to choke/to cram/to fill up/to stuff/to take up all the space
